data.title: Reviews of Jake Speed
data.text:
Click here for full review

Not all Indiana Jones rip-offs are created equal. Romancing the Stone and The Mummy (1999) being the best of the best. All iterations of Tomb Raider being in the mid-range. Finally, all the rest are crap. Well, with one giant exception; Jake Speed (oh and of course Firewalker)

Margaret’s (Karen Kopins) sister has been kidnaped by White Sex Traffickers. Margaret’s family, other than her grandfather, are a bunch of assholes blaming her. Grandpa has a…

In an alternate universe where all the pulp adventure novels are based on real heroes, Jake Speed offers to find a woman's kidnapped sister in Africa.

What a disappointment, this was a good idea ruined by bad writing and a terrible lead actor. It plays like a satire and homage to the adventure genre at the same time and does neither very well. The big thing bringing the movie down is Wayne Crawford as the title character. Wayne was also…

POTENTIALLY TAKES PLACE IN THE SAME UNIVERSE AS REMO WILLIAMS THIS IS ENORMOUS NEWS

So it's kinda like a dimestore Romancing the Stone meets a G-League Last Action Hero, set in a world where Doc Savage, Mack Bolan, and Remo Williams (aka The Destroyer) exist. Presumably Dirk Pitt and even Richard Camelion (aka the Death Merchant) are out there getting up to shit. Maybe even my man Court Gentry (aka the Gray Man) was toddling around, waiting until he was…
